si.JDEXi

Class Attribute

  • java.lang.Object
    • si.JDEXi.Attribute

  • public class Attribute
extends java.lang.Object
    Attribute class.

    Implements DEXi attribute, which is defined by:

    • String name: attribute name
    • String description: a textual description
    • Scale scale: list of values that can be assigned to the attribute
    • ArrayList function: utility function
    • ArrayList attributes: array of the attribute's immediate descendants in attribute hierarchy
    • Attribute link: linked attribute (considered "logically" the same as this attribute)
    Version:
    2.0 PD Version "PD" is tailor made for project FIRST and adds some function editing capabilities
    Author:
    Andrej Kogovšek, Dušan Omerèeviæ, Marko Bohanec

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate()
        Fast evaluation of this.attribute and its descendants. Works only with single values, not value distributions.

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(Model.Evaluation evalType,
            boolean normalize)
        Full evaluation of this.attribute and its descendants. Works with value distributions.
        Parameters:
        evalType - Evaluation type.
        normalize - If true, normalize results after ealuation.

      • prepareInputDistribution

        public void prepareInputDistribution(Model.Evaluation evalType,
                            boolean normalize)
        Prepare input value distribution of this.attribute (before evaluation). If a single value is defined, it is converted to distribution. If there is no single value or scale is missing, a full value set is assigned to distribution. If normalize==true, the distribution is finally normalized.
        Parameters:
        evalType -
        normalize -

      • prepareOutputDistribution

        public void prepareOutputDistribution(Model.Evaluation evalType,
                             boolean normalize)
        Process output value distribution of this.attribute (after evaluation). First, distribution is normalized (when normalize==true) and then converted to a single value, if possible.
        Parameters:
        evalType -
        normalize -

        protected void setValueSmart(java.lang.String aValue)
        Set single value by string smartly.
        Parameters:
        aValue - String can have one of the forms: (1) literal string, indicating attribute name, (2) numeric string, indicating a one-based ordinal number, or (3) numeric string starting with "0", indicating a zero-based ordinal number.
